content.description:
Climb the 5.0 face beneath the nose of the roof.  Pull the roof at it's apex 5.7 or the left and right variations which are a little easier.               

The Sphynx route in red.  The left and right sides are 5.1-5.2
content.protection: Top system from gear and trees.
content.location: The Sphynx is located on the far right (south) end of the outcrop

content.description:
Ridge Rocks is a 600 foot band of small cliffs, rocks, and boulders. It is located adjacent to the Ridge Trail on the Northern boundary of Frederick Watershed. The rock faces south and offers some views of the watershed below. Most climbing appears to be very easy, very short, or very difficult if not impossible. There are also plenty of potential boulder problems. See the pictures for more outcrops here.                 

The Beehive Wall (35') is located in the middle of the rock band. We couldn't find any starts to get off the ground.  A good project for aspiring 5.13 climbers.
